revised_title: Rare Arthropods of the Burgess Shale: Middle Cambrian Fossils from British Columbia
tldr: This article describes six rare species of arthropods found in the Burgess Shale, Middle Cambrian deposits in British Columbia. The author provides detailed descriptions and discussions of each species, including Molaria spinifera, Habelia optata, Sarotrocercus oblita, Actaeus armatus, and Alalcomenaeus cambricus. These species extend the known range of variation in morphology of the Burgess Shale arthropods and provide insights into their possible affinities and ecological roles.
